name: hello-chat-participant
description: A simple hello world chat participant for GitHub Copilot

chatParticipants.name: hello
chatParticipants.description: A simple hello world chat participant

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_get_time
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Gets the current date and time. Use this tool when the user asks what time it is, what the current date is, or anything related to the current time.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the current date and time

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_github_clone
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Clones a GitHub repository to the local workspace. Use this tool when the user wants to download, clone, or get source code from a GitHub repository. The user should provide the repository in 'owner/repo' format (e.g., 'microsoft/vscode'). Optionally accepts a branch name.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Clone a GitHub repository to your workspace

repoName.description: The GitHub repository to clone in 'owner/repo' format (e.g., 'microsoft/vscode')

branch.description: Optional branch name to clone. If not specified, the default branch will be used.

targetFolder.description: Optional folder name to clone into. If not specified, the repository name will be used.

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_run_terminal_command
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Executes a command in the VS Code integrated terminal. Use this tool when the user asks to run a shell command, execute a script, or perform an action in the terminal.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Run a command in the terminal

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_github_vulnerabilities
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Checks for code scanning alerts (vulnerabilities) on the current GitHub repository branch. Use this tool when the user asks about security issues, vulnerabilities, or code scanning alerts.

owner.description: The repository owner. Optional, inferred from current workspace.

repo.description: The repository name. Optional, inferred from current workspace.

branch.description: The branch name. Optional, inferred from current workspace.

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_run_vscode_command
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Executes a VS Code command from the command palette. Use this tool when the user wants to run a VS Code command like 'Checkmarx:: Scan Current File', workbench commands, or any other command available in the command palette. The user provides the command ID (e.g., 'checkmarx.scanCurrentFile' or 'workbench.action.files.save').
languageModelTools.userDescription: Run a VS Code command from the command palette

commandId.description: The VS Code command ID to execute (e.g., 'checkmarx.scanCurrentFile', 'workbench.action.files.save')

args.description: Optional arguments to pass to the command

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_list_vscode_commands
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all available VS Code commands. Use this tool when the user wants to see what commands are available, search for a specific command, or find command IDs to use with the runVscodeCommand tool.

filter.description: Optional filter to search for specific commands (e.g., 'checkmarx', 'git', 'file')

limit.description: Optional limit on number of results (default: 50)

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_reminderme
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Sets a recurring reminder. When the time elapses, it uses the LLM to generate content based on the prompt and displays it to the user. Use this when the user wants to be reminded of something repeatedly, or wants to practice something (like interview questions) at intervals.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Set a recurring reminder with LLM content

prompt.description: The prompt to send to the LLM to generate the reminder content

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_log_analysis
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Monitors a specified Output Channel for new messages and analyzes them with an LLM. Use this when the user asks to analyze logs, output, or error messages from another extension (e.g., 'Checkmarx', 'Git'). Notes: The Output Channel must be open and visible.

channelName.description: Name of the Output Channel to monitor (e.g. 'Checkmarx')

prompt.description: Optional prompt to guide the analysis (e.g. 'Summarize errors')

languageModelTools.name: hello-chat-participant_checkmarx_scan
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Triggers a Checkmarx code scan for a specific folder. Use this tool when the user asks to scan a folder, project, or workspace with Checkmarx.

folderPath.description: Absolute path to the folder to scan

baseUrl.description: Optional Checkmarx base URL for login
